text: I felt like my body had been invaded it
felt like I had another voice in my head
telling me things with Benjamin I don't
know everything was just different
my husband's a tanker in the army he'd
always wanted to be a dad when I found
out I was pregnant with Christopher it
was unlike anything item felt everything
was natural and comfortable and I had
instant love I got pregnant with
Benjamin when Christopher was three and
a half four months old
it was unplanned unexpected unwanted I
brought up having an abortion before we
found out that I was 20 weeks I felt
like it was too soon
we weren't financially ready it was
horrible to see my body go through that
again
he didn't feel like my baby guy had
created this little person I couldn't
stand to hear him scream I could not
stand it any time that I had thoughts of
hurting Benjamin I tried to push them
away I was trying to feed him vegetables
and like most kids he hated vegetables
in my frustration I I I forced I strove
to spoonful of it into his mouth and I
forced him to shut in his mouth I just
remember just ripping that onesie off of
him and putting him in the bathtub
I kept the nozzle on his face
and then quieted I just cried because I
couldn't believe that I had hurt my baby
like that when I finally told Jeff that
I didn't feel a bond or connection with
Benjamin we were sitting in his nursery
I just said I don't love Benjamin I
don't love him he was horrified
it was time that I sought help I didn't
have a perfect childhood I did not seek
support from my family members because I
wasn't close with them when I started
getting help they put me on a medication
and it made things order finally my
doctor gave me a combination of two I
started to see Benjamin differently
I wish I would have known more about
postpartum depression and moreso
psychosis I fear that he will be
affected by this emotionally did me
every day I work with Benjamin because
the trust is still not there 100%
I was deeply ashamed of feeling out of
control of my mind that you want some in
your hair I questioned my sanity I
questioned if I really was the good
person that I thought that I was and
you're pretty yeah my support was my
husband every time a medication didn't
work he was there for me I can say that
I loved Benjamin but I could never say
before that many loved me
you had no idea what I would feel you
never knew what side of me he would get
I promised him every day that I'm here
for him and then I'm going to protect
him and keep him safe
I'm his mother now and he knows that I'm
not going to hurt him I think many many
loves me now too
all
